meta_description.title: Silent Hill: True Story & Real Town's History Explained
meta_description.text: 18-Oct-2021 — The town of Silent Hill, West Virginia is actually Centralia, Pennsylvania. In May 1962, the town ordered to have the local landfill burned in ...

people_also_ask.question: What is the story behind Silent Hill?
people_also_ask.heading: The town of Silent Hill, West Virginia is actually Centralia, Pennsylvania. In May 1962, the town ordered to have the local landfill burned in an attempt to cleanup the waste. The fire spread through unsealed tunnels and openings that led to an abandoned coal mine. Thus, igniting the fire that burns to this day.18-Oct-2021
people_also_ask.title: Silent Hill: True Story & Real Town's History Explained

people_also_ask.question: Is Silent Hill based on a real town?
people_also_ask.heading: The True Story & Real History of Silent Hill The town of Silent Hill, West Virginia is actually Centralia, Pennsylvania. In May 1962, the town ordered to have the local landfill burned in an attempt to cleanup the waste. The fire spread through unsealed tunnels and openings that led to an abandoned coal mine.18-Oct-2021

knowledge_panel.description: rose and her daughter, sharon, leave their house to go to silent hill. on their way rose meets with an accident knocking her unconscious and when she awakes, sharon is missing.
